    Double question mark(??)

    $foo = $bar ?? ‘something’ 위 코드의 결과는 $bar 변수가 존재할 경우 $bar 를 리턴하고 없을 경우 something 이 리턴됩니다.

    It’s the “null coalescing operator”, added in php 7.0. The definition of how it works is:

    It returns its first operand if it exists and is not NULL; otherwise it returns its second operand.

    So it’s actually just isset() in a handy operator.

    Those two are equivalent1:

    $foo = $bar ?? ‘something’; $foo = isset($bar) ? $bar : ‘something’; Documentation: http://php.net/manual/en/language.operators.comparison.php#language.operators.comparison.coalesce

    In the list of new PHP7 features: http://php.net/manual/en/migration70.new-features.php#migration70.new-features.null-coalesce-op

    And original RFC https://wiki.php.net/rfc/isset_ternary

    EDIT: As this answer gets a lot of views, little clarification:

    1There is a difference: In case of ??, the first expression is evaluated only once, as opposed to ? :, where the expression is first evaluated in the condition section, then the second time in the “answer” section.
